17  package com.okta.sdk.impl.cache;
18  
19  import com.okta.sdk.cache.Cache;
20  import com.okta.sdk.impl.util.SoftHashMap;
21  import com.okta.sdk.lang.Assert;
22  import com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration;
23  import org.slf4j.Logger;
24  import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
25  
26  import java.util.Map;
27  import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
28  import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicLong;
29  
30  /**
31   * A {@code DefaultCache} is a {@link Cache Cache} implementation that uses a backing {@link Map} instance to store
32   * and retrieve cached data.
33   * <h1>Thread Safety</h1>
34   * This implementation is thread-safe <em>only</em> if the backing map is thread-safe.
35   *
36   * @since 0.5.0
37   */
38  public class DefaultCache<K, V> implements Cache<K, V> {
39  
40      private final Logger logger = LoggerFactory.getLogger(DefaultCache.class);
41  
42      /**
43       * Backing map instance that stores the cache entries.
44       */
45      private final Map<K, Entry<V>> map;
46  
47      /**
48       * The amount of time allowed to pass since an entry was first created.  An entry older than this time,
49       * <b>regardless of how often it might be used</b>, will be removed from the cache as soon as possible.
50       */
51      private volatile Duration timeToLive;
52  
53      /**
54       * The amount of time allowed to pass since an entry was last used (inserted or accessed).  An entry that has not
55       * been used in this amount of time will be removed from the cache as soon as possible.
56       */
57      private volatile Duration timeToIdle;
58  
59      /**
60       * The name of this cache.
61       */
62      private final String name;
63  
64      private final AtomicLong accessCount;
65      private final AtomicLong hitCount;
66      private final AtomicLong missCount;
67  
68      /**
69       * Creates a new {@code DefaultCache} instance with the specified {@code name}, expected to be unique among all
70       * other caches in the parent {@code CacheManager}.
71       * <p>
72       * This constructor uses a {@link SoftHashMap} instance as the cache's backing map, which is thread-safe and
73       * auto-sizes itself based on the application's memory constraints.
74       * <p>
75       * Finally, the {@link #setTimeToIdle(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration) timeToIdle} and
76       * {@link #setTimeToLive(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration) timeToLive} settings are both {@code null},
77       * indicating that cache entries will live indefinitely (except due to memory constraints as managed by the
78       * {@code SoftHashMap}).
79       *
80       * @param name the name to assign to this instance, expected to be unique among all other caches in the parent
81       *             {@code CacheManager}.
82       * @see SoftHashMap
83       * @see #setTimeToIdle(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration)
84       * @see #setTimeToLive(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration)
85       */
86      public DefaultCache(String name) {
87          this(name, new SoftHashMap<K, Entry<V>>());
88      }
89  
90      /**
91       * Creates a new {@code DefaultCache} instance with the specified {@code name}, storing entries in the specified
92       * {@code backingMap}.  It is expected that the {@code backingMap} implementation be thread-safe and preferrably
93       * auto-sizing based on memory constraints (see {@link SoftHashMap} for such an implementation).
94       * <p>
95       * The {@link #setTimeToIdle(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration) timeToIdle} and
96       * {@link #setTimeToLive(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration) timeToLive} settings are both {@code null},
97       * indicating that cache entries will live indefinitely (except due to memory constraints as managed by the
98       * {@code backingMap} instance).
99       *
100      * @param name       name to assign to this instance, expected to be unique among all other caches in the parent
101      *                   {@code CacheManager}.
102      * @param backingMap the (ideally thread-safe) map instance to store the Cache entries.
103      * @see SoftHashMap
104      * @see #setTimeToIdle(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration)
105      * @see #setTimeToLive(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration)
106      */
107     public DefaultCache(String name, Map<K, Entry<V>> backingMap) {
108         this(name, backingMap, null, null);
109     }
110 
111     /**
112      * Creates a new {@code DefaultCache} instance with the specified {@code name}, storing entries in the specified
113      * {@code backingMap}, using the specified {@code timeToLive} and {@code timeToIdle} settings.
114      * <p>
115      * It is expected that the {@code backingMap} implementation be thread-safe and preferrably
116      * auto-sizing based on memory constraints (see {@link SoftHashMap} for such an implementation).
117      *
118      * @param name       name to assign to this instance, expected to be unique among all other caches in the parent
119      *                   {@code CacheManager}.
120      * @param backingMap the (ideally thread-safe) map instance to store the Cache entries.
121      * @param timeToIdle the amount of time cache entries may remain idle until they should be removed from the cache.
122      * @param timeToLive the amount of time cache entries may exist until they should be removed from the cache.
123      * @throws IllegalArgumentException if either {@code timeToLive} or {@code timeToIdle} are non-null <em>and</em>
124      *                                  represent a non-positive (zero or negative) value. This is only enforced for
125      *                                  non-null values - {@code null} values are allowed for either argument.
126      * @see #setTimeToIdle(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration)
127      * @see #setTimeToLive(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration)
128      */
129     public DefaultCache(String name, Map<K, Entry<V>> backingMap, Duration timeToLive, Duration timeToIdle) {
130         Assert.notNull(name, "Cache name cannot be null.");
131         Assert.notNull(backingMap, "Backing map cannot be null.");
132         assertTtl(timeToLive);
133         assertTti(timeToIdle);
134         this.name = name;
135         this.map = backingMap;
136         this.timeToLive = timeToLive;
137         this.timeToIdle = timeToIdle;
138         this.accessCount = new AtomicLong(0);
139         this.hitCount = new AtomicLong(0);
140         this.missCount = new AtomicLong(0);
141     }
142 
143     protected static void assertTtl(Duration ttl) {
144         if (ttl != null) {
145             Assert.isTrue(ttl.getValue() > 0, "timeToLive duration must be greater than zero");
146         }
147     }
148 
149     protected static void assertTti(Duration tti) {
150         if (tti != null) {
151             Assert.isTrue(tti.getValue() > 0, "timeToIdle duration must be greater than zero");
152         }
153     }
154 
155     public V get(K key) {
156 
157         this.accessCount.incrementAndGet();
158 
159         Entry<V> entry = map.get(key);
160 
161         if (entry == null) {
162             missCount.incrementAndGet();
163             return null;
164         }
165 
166         long nowMillis = System.currentTimeMillis();
167 
168         Duration ttl = this.timeToLive;
169         Duration tti = this.timeToIdle;
170 
171         if (ttl != null) {
172             Duration sinceCreation = new Duration(nowMillis - entry.getCreationTimeMillis(), TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);
173             if (sinceCreation.isGreaterThan(ttl)) {
174                 map.remove(key);
175                 missCount.incrementAndGet(); //count an expired TTL as a miss
176                 logger.trace("Removing {} from cache due to TTL, sinceCreation: {}", key, sinceCreation);
177                 return null;
178             }
179         }
180 
181         if (tti != null) {
182             Duration sinceLastAccess = new Duration(nowMillis - entry.getLastAccessTimeMillis(), TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);
183             if (sinceLastAccess.isGreaterThan(tti)) {
184                 map.remove(key);
185                 missCount.incrementAndGet(); //count an expired TTI as a miss
186                 logger.trace("Removing {} from cache due to TTI, sinceLastAccess: {}", key, sinceLastAccess);
187                 return null;
188             }
189         }
190 
191         entry.lastAccessTimeMillis = nowMillis;
192 
193         hitCount.incrementAndGet();
194 
195         return entry.getValue();
196     }
197 
198     public V put(K key, V value) {
199         Entry<V> newEntry = new Entry<V>(value);
200         Entry<V> previous = map.put(key, newEntry);
201         if (previous != null) {
202             return previous.value;
203         }
204         return null;
205     }
206 
207     @Override
208     public V remove(K key) {
209         accessCount.incrementAndGet();
210         Entry<V> previous = map.remove(key);
211         if (previous != null) {
212             hitCount.incrementAndGet();
213             return previous.value;
214         } else {
215             missCount.incrementAndGet();
216             return null;
217         }
218     }
219 
220     /**
221      * Returns the amount of time a cache entry may exist after first being created before it will expire and no
222      * longer be available.  If a cache entry ever becomes older than this amount of time (regardless of how often
223      * it is accessed), it will be removed from the cache as soon as possible.
224      *
225      * @return the amount of time a cache entry may exist after first being created before it will expire and no
226      *         longer be available.
227      */
228     public Duration getTimeToLive() {
229         return timeToLive;
230     }
231 
232     /**
233      * Sets the amount of time a cache entry may exist after first being created before it will expire and no
234      * longer be available.  If a cache entry ever becomes older than this amount of time (regardless of how often
235      * it is accessed), it will be removed from the cache as soon as possible.
236      *
237      * @param timeToLive the amount of time a cache entry may exist after first being created before it will expire and
238      *                   no longer be available.
239      */
240     public void setTimeToLive(Duration timeToLive) {
241         assertTtl(timeToLive);
242         this.timeToLive = timeToLive;
243     }
244 
245     /**
246      * Returns the amount of time a cache entry may be idle - unused (not accessed) - before it will expire and
247      * no longer be available.  If a cache entry is not accessed at all after this amount of time, it will be
248      * removed from the cache as soon as possible.
249      *
250      * @return the amount of time a cache entry may be idle - unused (not accessed) - before it will expire and
251      *         no longer be available.
252      */
253     public Duration getTimeToIdle() {
254         return timeToIdle;
255     }
256 
257     /**
258      * Sets the amount of time a cache entry may be idle - unused (not accessed) - before it will expire and
259      * no longer be available.  If a cache entry is not accessed at all after this amount of time, it will be
260      * removed from the cache as soon as possible.
261      *
262      * @param timeToIdle the amount of time a cache entry may be idle - unused (not accessed) - before it will expire
263      *                   and no longer be available.
264      */
265     public void setTimeToIdle(Duration timeToIdle) {
266         assertTti(timeToIdle);
267         this.timeToIdle = timeToIdle;
268     }
269 
270     /**
271      * Returns the number of attempts to return a cache entry.  Note that because {@link #remove(Object)} will return
272      * a value, calls to both {@link #get(Object)} and {@link #remove(Object)} will increment this number.
273      *
274      * @return the number of attempts to return a cache entry
275      * @see #getHitCount()
276      * @see #getMissCount()
277      * @see #getHitRatio()
278      */
279     public long getAccessCount() {
280         return this.accessCount.get();
281     }
282 
283     /**
284      * Returns the total number of times an access attempt successfully returned a cache entry.
285      *
286      * @return the total number of times an access attempt successfully returned a cache entry.
287      * @see #getMissCount()
288      * @see #getHitRatio()
289      */
290     public long getHitCount() {
291         return hitCount.get();
292     }
293 
294     /**
295      * Returns the total number of times an access attempt did not return a cache entry.
296      *
297      * @return the total number of times an access attempt successfully returned a cache entry.
298      * @see #getHitCount()
299      * @see #getHitRatio()
300      */
301     public long getMissCount() {
302         return missCount.get();
303     }
304 
305     /**
306      * Returns the ratio of {@link #getHitCount() hitCount} to {@link #getAccessCount() accessCount}.  The closer this
307      * number is to {@code 1.0}, the more effectively the cache is being used.  The closer this number is to
308      * {code 0.0}, the less effectively the cache is being used.
309      *
310      * @return the ratio of {@link #getHitCount() hitCount} to {@link #getAccessCount() accessCount}.
311      */
312     public double getHitRatio() {
313         double accessCount = (double) getAccessCount();
314         if (accessCount > 0) {
315             double hitCount = (double) getHitCount();
316 
317             return hitCount / accessCount;
318         }
319         return 0;
320     }
321 
322     /**
323      * Removes all entries from this cache.
324      */
325     public void clear() {
326         map.clear();
327     }
328 
329     /**
330      * Returns the total number of cache entries currently available in this cache.
331      *
332      * @return the total number of cache entries currently available in this cache.
333      */
334     public int size() {
335         return map.size();
336     }
337 
338     /**
339      * Returns this cache instance's name.
340      *
341      * @return this cache instance's name.
342      */
343     public String getName() {
344         return this.name;
345     }
346 
347     public String toString() {
348         return new StringBuilder("    {\n      \"name\": \"").append(name).append("\",\n")
349                 .append("      \"size\": ").append(map.size()).append(",\n")
350                 .append("      \"accessCount\": ").append(getAccessCount()).append(",\n")
351                 .append("      \"hitCount\": ").append(getHitCount()).append(",\n")
352                 .append("      \"missCount\": ").append(getMissCount()).append(",\n")
353                 .append("      \"hitRatio\": ").append(getHitRatio()).append("\n")
354                 .append("    }")
355                 .toString();
356     }
357 
358     /**
359      * An Entry is a wrapper that encapsulates the actual {@code value} stored in the cache as well as
360      * {@link #getCreationTimeMillis() creationTimeMillis} and {@link #getLastAccessTimeMillis() lastAccessTimeMillis}
361      * metadata about the entry itself.  The {@code creationTimeMillis} and {@code lastAccessTimeMillis} values are used
362      * to support expunging cache entries based on
363      * {@link DefaultCache#getTimeToIdle() timeToIdle} and
364      * {@link DefaultCache#getTimeToLive() timeToLive} settings, respectively.
365      *
366      * @param <V> the type of value that is stored in the cache.
367      */
368     public static class Entry<V> {
369 
370         private final V value;
371         private final long creationTimeMillis;
372         private volatile long lastAccessTimeMillis;
373 
374         /**
375          * Creates a new Entry instance wrapping the specified {@code value}, defaulting both the
376          * {@link #getCreationTimeMillis() creationTimeMillis} and the {@link #getLastAccessTimeMillis() lastAccessTimeMills}
377          * to the current timestamp (i.e. {@link System#currentTimeMillis()}).
378          *
379          * @param value the cache entry to store.
380          */
381         public Entry(V value) {
382             this.value = value;
383             this.creationTimeMillis = System.currentTimeMillis();
384             this.lastAccessTimeMillis = this.creationTimeMillis;
385         }
386 
387         /**
388          * Returns the actual value stored in the cache.
389          *
390          * @return the actual value stored in the cache.
391          */
392         public V getValue() {
393             return value;
394         }
395 
396         /**
397          * Returns the creation time in millis since Epoch when this {@code Entry} instance was created.  This is used to
398          * support expunging cache entries when this value is older than the cache's
399          * {@link DefaultCache#getTimeToLive() timeToLive} setting.
400          *
401          * @return the creation time in millis since Epoch when this {@code Entry} instance was created.
402          */
403         public long getCreationTimeMillis() {
404             return creationTimeMillis;
405         }
406 
407         /**
408          * Returns the time in millis since Epoch when this {@code Entry} instance was last accessed.  This is used to
409          * support expunging cache entries when this value is older than the cache's
410          * {@link DefaultCache#getTimeToIdle() timeToIdle} setting.
411          *
412          * @return the time in millis since Epoch when this {@code Entry} instance was last accessed.
413          */
414         public long getLastAccessTimeMillis() {
415             return lastAccessTimeMillis;
416         }
417     }
418 }
